alert.note: Alert for Bonner; Boundary (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 07 at 3:27AM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of North Idaho, including the following counties, Bonner, Boundary and Shoshone. Portions of Washington, including the following counties, Chelan, Ferry, Okanogan, Pend Oreille and Stevens. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Slow moving thunderstorms today will increase the risk for flash flooding across the steep terrain and burned areas of north central and northeast Washington, as well as the northern Idaho Panhandle. Runoff and excessive rain will be capable of producing rock and mud slides as well as debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
